definition: to investigate (as detective)/to solve (crime)/to uncover (a plot)/to sniff out/to break in and analyze/detective work/to scout
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of

sentences.english: Director Zhang solved an intricate case soon after he took his post.
sentences.chinese: 局長剛上任不久就將一件無頭案偵破了。

sentences.english: Women and girls account for about 80 per cent of the detected victims.
sentences.chinese: 偵破發現的受害者中婦女和女孩佔了80%。

sentences.english: The detective believes the missing gun is the key to the mystery.
sentences.chinese: 那刺探認爲那把丟失的槍是偵破這宗疑案的線索。

sentences.english: The police cracked a murder case last week.
sentences.chinese: 警察上週偵破了一件兇殺案。

sentences.english: The crime must be solved so that the murderer can be arrested, but also, so that calm can be restored.
sentences.chinese: 必須偵破案件，抓住殺人犯，恢復寧靜的生活。

sentences.english: All efforts were made to progress the case as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 所有的努力都是爲了儘快偵破這個案件。

sentences.english: The police promised to leave no stone unturned in solving the murder.
sentences.chinese: 警察承諾要想盡辦法偵破那樁謀殺案。

sentences.english: A poly-line along the edges of the features that has been successfully detected.
sentences.chinese: 一個折線沿着已成功偵破特徵的邊緣。

sentences.english: A trained person can detect many lies by observing body language.
sentences.chinese: 一個受過訓練的人可以通過觀察肢體語言來偵破謊言。

sentences.english: I have a wonderful who-dun-it novel, do you want to read it?
sentences.chinese: 我有一本精彩的偵破小說，你想看麼？

sentences.english: This policewoman’s job is to detect robbery.
sentences.chinese: 那個女警的任務是偵破搶劫案件。

sentences.english: The police can find no finger print or other clue to help them in solving the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 警方找不到指印或其他線索來幫助他們偵破搶劫案件。

sentences.english: The insurance company ferreted out the truth about the fire.
sentences.chinese: 保險公司偵破了那場火災的真相。

sentences.english: The detection takes place by UV at 210 nm.
sentences.chinese: 偵破發生在210納米的紫外線。

sentences.english: This is a case even Sherlock Holmes might have found difficult to solve.
sentences.chinese: 這可能是一例福爾摩斯也難偵破的案件。

sentences.english: The clues are too sketchy, so it's hard to carry out our detective work .
sentences.chinese: 由於線索過於疏略，我們的偵破工作難度很大。

definition: to uncover (a criminal plot)/to break open and capture
to track down and seize (a criminal suspect, contraband etc)
to intercept/to cut off and capture
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
(of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
to set on fire/to commit arson
to take action/to adopt policies/to move on some issue
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
